intro: Otiophora inyangana var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved starry bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically small, ovate, and arranged oppositely along the stems. This variety is distinguished by its reduced leaf size compared to the typical form of Otiophora inyangana. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
